reviewText: I hate to say this but this play is a disaster and a waste of film.  It even started off ridiculous.  I am a very analytical film watcher and I watch a lot of black plays & movies.  This is right up there with Three Ways to Get A Husband;  Ride;  Cookout & Heaven Ain't Hard to Find to name a few.  These films were all ridiculous & pointless in delivering a message and comedic entertainment.  Come on people, if you're going to take the time & money to produce a film please make it quality and stop doing the same ole crap and incorporating stereotypes & buffoonery with no plot, no point and no rhyme or reason.  Seems like the current independent black plays are about nothing but showing abs, sashaying & strutting around pointlessly in tight, short dresses with hooker heels on & wearing long ass weaves & wigs that can't even be mistaken for real hair, and it seems like it's a must to throw in a gay man.  Come on people, let's show not just white people but all people that black people can produce quality films with good story lines like Best Man; Love & Basketball; Barber Shop  & The Brothers, and even independent films like Kings of the Evening; N-Secure; Blessed & Cursed & one that Christian Keys was also in titled Love Me or Leave Me.  Please people, let any future films you make be made without any stereotyping & buffoonery because that's not entertainment, that's just embarrassing the race in the same manner that our black people are embarrassing themselves on Maury Povich.  I have NEVER taken out time to type in my commentary on a film but this just pushed me over the edge.  I'm trying to support my people in black independent films but I don't know if I can take much more if this type of pointless, low quality foolishness continues.  The concept trying to show the role of demons & angels interacting in relationships was a good concept but it was never carried out.  Most of the focus was on a trampy looking, so-called female demon strutting around in a tight, short, red dress with 5 inch hooker heels and a long, fake wig, and her partner in crime, the devil with the horror flick voice & the sleeveless shirt that showed off his "guns."  Then we have the two thug angels with casual wear and caps on backwards instead of white dignified suits or at least an all white outfit that angels would be expected to wear.  Office workers weren't working, instead they were just hanging around clowning & the female's behavior towards the client was very inappropriate.  We don't need to see this type of foolishness in a so-called gospel play that's delivering a moral message. The whole kidnapping concept was so far out of left field that it was just baffling so I couldn't feel any sympathy for the situation at this point in the play.  To try to be serious & quote bible scriptures at the end of all of this foolishness was just disturbing.  Bottom line, the old thing was just a mess.
